question: Diagnostic sign of a fracture
exp: Diagnostic sign of a fracture is abnormal mobility at fracture site. Pathognomic sign of traumatic and fresh fracture is crepitus. ref: maheswari, 5thedition, page no. 12
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: which of the following is a Bone resorption marker is?
exp: Deoxypyridinoline (DPD) in urine, which reflects systemic bone resorption, is considered most useful for assessing the effects of osteoporosis treatment.
opa: Serum propeptide of type I procollagen
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: what Type of collagen is found in bone?
exp: Type 1 collagen fibres, derived from tropocollagen molecules produced by osteoblasts, make up over 80 percent of unmineralized matrix. They form a network which emboides a mucopolysaccharide(proteoglycans)ground substance and also acts as a scaffold on which the mineral component-crystalline hydroxyapatite is deposited. ref: apley&; s textbook, 9th edition page no. 118
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: The bone matrix has the following crystals
exp: The bone is made up of bone cells and extracellular matrix. The matrix consists oftwo types of materials, organic and inorganic. The organic matrix is formed by the collagen, which forms 30-35% of dry weight of a bone. The inorganic matrix is primarily calcium and phophorus salts, especially hydroxyapatite. It constitutes about 65-70% of dry weight of a bone. ref: maheswari, 5th edition page no. 9
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: Non-union is a complication of which of the following?
exp: Sites of non union: Femur neck fracture Scaphoid fracture Tibia fracture Lateral condyle humerus fracture Fracture lower 3rd ulna Radiological features of nonunion of scaphoid: Rounding of fracture surfaces Fractures become sharply defined Cystic changes occur in one or both fragments Ref: Maheshwari and Mhaskar 9th ed pg 116.
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: Headlight in fog appearance in retina
exp: White focal retinitis with overlying vitreous inflammation ("headlight in the fog") is seen in Toxoplasmosis
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: What is March fracture?
exp: March fracture, also known as Insufficiency fracture is a stress or fatigue fractures of the metatarsals paicularly the second metatarsal bone. It is more often seen in military personnel who induge in frequent and prolonged marching. ref: john ebnezar textbook, page no. 288
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: Rate of newly synthesized osteoid mineralization can be best estimated by
exp: Rate of mineralisation is determined by Labelled Tetracycline. ref: maheswari, 5th edition page no. 12
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing

question: Frieberg's disease involve
exp: condition characterized by infarction and fracture of the metatarsal head. Most often seen in 2nd metatarsal (MT) head, paicularly the dorsal aspect4th and 5th MT rarely affected Bony nucleus of epiphysis is affected in osteochondritis Ref: Maheshwari and Mhaskar 6e pg 318.
topic_name: Anatomy and physiology of bone and fracture healing
